## Deferred class

Promise wrapper that allows to manipulate it more easily by making `resolve` and `reject` accessible outside the usual callback.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class Deferred<T>
```

## Properties

| Property                         | Modifiers | Type                                     | Description           |
| -------------------------------- | --------- | ---------------------------------------- | --------------------- |
| [promise](./Deferred.promise.md) |           | <code>Promise&lt;T&gt;</code>            |                       |
| [reject](./Deferred.reject.md)   |           | <code>(...args: any[]) =&gt; void</code> | Rejects the promise.  |
| [resolve](./Deferred.resolve.md) |           | <code>(...args: any[]) =&gt; void</code> | Resolves the promise. |
